seo.title: Veo 3.1 First/Last – First & Last Frame to Video (720p/1080p, up to 8s)
seo.description: Bridge two frames with Veo 3.1 First/Last. Upload start + end frames, add a prompt, choose 4/6/8s at 720p or 1080p, optional native audio. Perfect for seamless transitions and before/after stories in MaxVideoAI.

overview: Veo 3.1 First/Last in MaxVideoAI bridges two images with a directed, cinematic transition. You provide a first frame, a last frame, and a short prompt; Veo generates a smooth 4/6/8 second clip at 720p or 1080p, with optional native audio.

bestUseCases.title: Best use cases
items: Before/after transitions: product upgrades, glow-ups, environmental changes
Scene bridges in short films, ads or explainers
Logo or brand transitions using designed first and last keyframes
Stylized morphs between two character designs or environments
Camera moves from one layout to another without cutting

prompts.title: Office → Rooftop bridge (6s, 16:9)
prompts.prompt: Animate a 6s 16:9 cinematic transition from a bright office desk still to a night rooftop still with the same person. Slow dolly forward that gently arcs as the rooftop appears; daylight fades into cool blue/neon; audio shifts from office ambience to distant traffic and wind, no dialogue.

faqs.q: Do I have to provide both a first and a last frame?
faqs.a: Yes. First/Last is built to transition between two images; both are required. Use standard Veo 3.1 for pure text/image → video runs.

faqs.q: How long can these clips be?
faqs.a: Up to ~8 seconds in the underlying APIs. MaxVideoAI exposes 4/6/8s presets to keep prompts predictable.
You choose audio on/off per render. Audio on gives native ambience/SFX/VO; audio off is cheaper and ready for your own soundtrack.

faqs.q: Can I use First/Last for logo or UI transitions?
faqs.a: Yes. It’s ideal for animating logos or UI layouts from an initial design to a final one. Keep critical tiny text as post-production graphics.

faqs.q: When should I use normal Veo instead?
faqs.a: Use standard Veo 3.1 / Veo Fast when you don’t have fixed start/end frames or need multi-beat clips from text/image input.

custom.heroDesc1: Bridge two frames with Veo 3.1 First/Last: upload start and end images, add a prompt, and get a smooth 4/6/8s transition at 720p or 1080p with optional native audio.
custom.heroDesc2: Use it for scene bridges, before/after stories, logo/UI morphs, and designed transitions where you already know the start and end composition.

custom.whatTitle: What Veo 3.1 First/Last actually is in MaxVideoAI
custom.whatIntro1: Google’s Veo 3.1 “first and last frame” / “Frames to Video” mode that interpolates between two images with optional audio.
custom.whatIntro2: In MaxVideoAI, you pick 4/6/8s, 16:9/9:16/1:1, 720p or 1080p, upload First + Last frames, toggle audio, and let Veo handle the transition.
whatFlowSteps: 2. Upload First frame and Last frame images.
3. Choose duration (4/6/8 s), aspect ratio (16:9 / 9:16 / 1:1), and resolution (720p or 1080p).
5. Write a prompt that describes how to go from A to B (camera, subject, pacing, style, audio).
6. Preview price per second, then generate.
custom.specTitle: Real Specs – Veo 3.1 First/Last in MaxVideoAI
custom.specNote: Reflects the current first/last-frame route in MaxVideoAI.

specSections.title: Duration & Output
items: UI options: 4 s, 6 s, 8 s
Model limit: ~8 s for first/last image-to-video
24 fps cinematic cadence

specSections.title: Aspect Ratios
items: 16:9 – landscape
9:16 – vertical (Reels, TikTok, Shorts)
1:1 – square

specSections.title: Inputs & File Types
items: First frame (required): PNG/JPG/JPEG/WebP/GIF/AVIF
Last frame (required): same formats
Prompt: describe how to animate between the frames; include action, style, camera, pacing, audio

specSections.title: Audio
items: Audio ON: native ambience/SFX/dialogue across the transition
Audio OFF: silent renders, cheaper and ready for your own mix

specSections.title: Pricing
items: Follows Veo 3.1 per-second config (e.g., ~ $0.20/s audio off, ~$0.40/s audio on)
Live wallet chip shows exact price before render — always check the live price chip in Generate for the current rate.

custom.specValueProp: A directed start–end transition engine with optional native audio, priced per second like Veo 3.1.
custom.galleryIntro: Real transitions: sketch → final render, office → rooftop, wireframe UI → high-fidelity UI.
custom.gallerySceneCta: Open this scene in Generate and swap your own first & last frames →
custom.promptIntro: Direct what happens between two images: define the start, the end, the journey, camera, pacing and audio.
promptPatternSteps: Describe the last frame: destination or transformation.
Camera path: dolly, orbit, pan, crane, POV or static morph.
Changes along the way: lighting, time of day, pose, style.
Pacing: gentle, brisk, dramatic; mid-point events.
custom.promptSkeleton: Animate smoothly from the first frame to the last frame over [duration] seconds in [aspect ratio]. Start with [subject/environment in first frame], then gradually [change/move/transform] until we reach [subject/environment in last frame]. Camera: [movement]. Lighting/style: [description]. Audio: [ambience/music/short VO, or “no dialogue”].
custom.promptSkeletonNote: Keep it focused on the journey from A → B; mention camera and pacing.
demoPrompt: Animate a 6 second 16:9 cinematic transition from a bright office desk still to a night rooftop still with the same person.
Camera: continuous dolly forward that becomes a gentle arc around the character.
Lighting: warm daylight blending into cool blue/neon highlights.
Audio: office ambience fading into distant traffic, wind and subtle electronic music, no dialogue.
strengths: Excellent for transitions when you already know start and end layouts
Great for before/after, logo/UI morphs, and scene bridges
Native audio matches gradual changes surprisingly well
boundaries: Max duration ~8s; chain clips for longer sequences
Requires two images; not for pure text shots
Tiny text or logos may warp; keep critical copy as post graphics
If start/end frames are radically different, transitions may feel surreal—give Veo some continuity
custom.tipsFooter: Use Veo 3.1 First/Last when you have strong start/end frames and need Veo to handle everything in between.
safetyRules: Don’t use frames of real public figures (politicians, celebrities, influencers)
Don’t impersonate private individuals without consent
No explicit sexual content or sexualized minors
Avoid hateful, harassing or extremist content
Some prompts or images may be blocked or adjusted by provider and MaxVideoAI safety layers
custom.safetyNote: Use First/Last for fictional characters, brand assets and product imagery—not deepfakes.
custom.comparisonTitle: Veo 3.1 First/Last vs Veo 3.1 vs Veo 3.1 Fast
comparisonPoints: Veo 3.1: general text/image→video with ingredients and extend; great for normal shots.
Veo 3.1 First/Last: specialized for start/end frame transitions with audio; perfect for scene changes and before/after.
Veo 3.1 Fast: cheaper, faster Veo variant; some providers expose Fast First/Last—great for prototyping transitions.
custom.comparisonCta: Compare Veo 3.1 First/Last vs Veo 3.1 / Veo 3.1 Fast →
custom.relatedSubtitle: Compare pricing, latency and control surfaces across the MaxVideoAI catalog.
custom.finalPara1: Veo 3.1 First/Last in MaxVideoAI is your start–end transition engine—built for moments where you already know the first and last frame.
custom.finalPara2: Use it to bridge scenes, logos, UI layouts or before/after beats with optional native audio, then stitch everything in one workflow.
